challenges.title: Turn your computer off
challenges.description: Using a screensaver uses unecessary energy. Turn it off or put it in sleepmode.

challenges.title: Use specific lighting
challenges.description: Instead of using ceiling lights, use desk lamps or track lighting instead.

challenges.title: Manage your thermostat
challenges.description: Lower your thermostat by 2Â°C. This can save you up to 5% on your heating bill

challenges.title: Clean your windows
challenges.description: Clean windows allow sunlight to light and heat up your house.

challenges.title: Use a powerstrip
challenges.description: Plug multiple gadgets into a powerstrip and turn it off when the items are not in use.

challenges.title: Drive less
challenges.description: Walk, bike, carpool or use public transport to travel to work or school.

challenges.title: Low-flow showerhead
challenges.description: Using a low-flow showerhead can cut your water usage in half.

challenges.title: Insulate your boiler
challenges.description: If you have an old boiler, put an insulating blanket around it to avoid standby heat.

challenges.title: Wash clothes in cold water
challenges.description: Wash your clothes in cold water. Laundry detergent works just as well in cold water nowadays.

challenges.title: Meal prep
challenges.description: When cooking with your oven, make multiple meals at once. Take advantage of the hot oven instead of having to reheat it every day.

challenges.title: Fill up your fridge
challenges.description: Fill your fridge and freezer with food, clothes, boxes, anything! Less cold air will escape every time you open the fridge.

challenges.title: Wrap your food
challenges.description: Food releases moisture, which will cause the compressor to work harder. Put your food in a container to avoid this.

challenges.title: Defrost food in fridge
challenges.description: If you want to defrost some food, put it in the fridge instead of on the counter. The food will release cold air, so the fridge will have to work less hard.

challenges.title: Use microwave instead of oven
challenges.description: Reheat your food in the microwave instead of the oven. The microwave works a lot faster so it uses less energy.

challenges.title: Boil the water you need
challenges.description: Don't fill up a whole kettle for one cup of tea. This will use unnecessary energy.

challenges.title: Tap aerators
challenges.description: Install tap aerators. They lower the amount of water you use with your taps.

challenges.title: Lay rugs
challenges.description: If you have tile flooring, lay rugs on it to keep your house (and feet) warm.

challenges.title: Create shading
challenges.description: Instead of blasting the AC all day, strategically place shading (such as plants, furniture, sails, ...) to keep your house cool.

challenges.title: Close garage
challenges.description: By keeping the garage door shut, you avoid losing heat in the adjacent rooms.

challenges.title: Fill your dishwasher
challenges.description: When using your dishwasher, make sure it's completely filled to avoid wasting water and energy.

challenges.title: Free your heaters
challenges.description: Avoid putting furniture in front of your radiator or heater. The radiator will have to work less hard if the air can move around freely.

challenges.title: Use LEDs
challenges.description: LED lighting will be more expensive to purchase, but will pay itself back with the savings on your electric bill.

challenges.title: Shower together
challenges.description: Shorter showers save a ton of water and electricity. Sharing showers will save even more!

challenges.title: Hang your clothes
challenges.description: Hang your clothes outside or on a rack instead of using the dryer.

challenges.title: Reusable bag
challenges.description: Take a reusable bag to go grocery shopping.

challenges.title: Reusable water bottle
challenges.description: Take a reusable water bottle with you to work/school/trips/...

challenges.title: Dishes by hand
challenges.description: Do your dishes by hand instead of using the dishwasher.

challenges.title: Close pots and pans
challenges.description: Put lids on pots and pans to reduce cooking times and avoid heat escaping.
